node.title: More wild weather on its way after Toowoomba slammed with hail, heavy rains
node.alt: Hail stones cover Toowoomba's main street
node.description: The Bureau of Meteorology warnsÂ of further storms for parts of south-east Queensland after hail and heavy rainfall swept across the Toowoomba region overnight.
node.content:
["The Bureau of Meteorology is warning of further storms for parts of south-east Queensland after intense hail and heavy rain swept\u00a0over the Toowoomba region last night.", "Senior Forecaster Felim Hanniffy said there had\u00a0been reports of \"copious amounts of small hail\", as\u00a0images and videos surfaced on social media showing significant damage to businesses in the Toowoomba city centre.", "Mr Hanniffy said yesterday's storm developed over north-eastern New South Wales before crossing the border, dumping isolated falls of 50 millimetres and half hour falls of\u00a030mm to 40mm\u00a0in some cases.", "", "
Hail covers a Toowoomba childcare centre playground.(Supplied: Lydia Baker)
", "A separate storm also dropped significant rainfall over\u00a0parts of Brisbane.", "Mr Hanniffy said the storm was \"caused by a trough and an upper feature\".", "He said\u00a0both storms had \"amplified instability\".", "The wild weather was\u00a0aided by moisture in the atmosphere, which \"kept the storms going overnight,\" Mr Hanniffy said.", "Meanwhile, another storm has formed north of Crows Nest, north of Toowoomba, which is predicted to continue moving to the north."]
